edge: Radhe is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Prabhu Deva and produced by Salman Khan, Sohail Khan, Atul Agnihotri and Zee Studios. In this film, Salman Khan plays the lead role of Radhe.
Disha Patani is an Indian actress who appears in Hindi films. She is cast opposite Salman Khan in the film Radhe, where she plays a pivotal role.
Randeep Hooda is an Indian actor who appears in Hindi films. He plays the antagonist in Radhe, opposite Salman Khan's lead character.
Jackie Shroff is an Indian actor who appears in Hindi films. He also plays a significant role in Radhe alongside Salman Khan's lead character.
Prabhu Deva is an Indian choreographer, director, and actor who primarily works in Tamil and Telugu films. He has also directed a Hindi film called Radhe featuring Salman Khan in the lead role.
Zee Studios is an Indian motion picture production and distribution company. They produced the Hindi film Radhe directed by Prabhu Deva, which features Salman Khan as the lead character.
Radhe is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Prabhu Deva. It is a remake of the 2017 South Korean film The Outlaws.
Radhe is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Prabhu Deva. It is a remake of the 2017 South Korean film The Outlaws.
Salman Khan is an Indian actor who appears in Hindi films. He plays the lead role of Radhe in the eponymous film directed by Prabhu Deva.
Disha Patani is an Indian actress who appears in Hindi films. She plays a pivotal role in Radhe opposite Salman Khan's lead character.
Randeep Hooda is an Indian actor who appears in Hindi films. He plays the antagonist in Radhe opposite Salman Khan's lead character.
Jackie Shroff is an Indian actor who appears in Hindi films. He also plays a significant role in Radhe alongside Salman Khan's lead character.
Prabhu Deva is an Indian choreographer, director, and actor who primarily works in Tamil and Telugu films. He has also directed a Hindi film called Radhe featuring Salman Khan as the lead character.
Zee Studios is an Indian motion picture production and distribution company. They produced the Hindi film Radhe directed by Prabhu Deva, which features Salman Khan as the lead character.
Rana kills a man who is an accomplice of Mansoor Bhai for not returning the money he borrowed from him.
Rana starts a drug business in Mumbai and sells drugs to college students and school children as well, leading to 12 suicides due to drug addiction in 3 months.
Mumbai Police sends two senior officers to stop Rana, but they are heavily drugged and killed by him.
Radhe is sent as an undercover police officer to resolve the case against Rana.
Radhe meets Diya Abhyankar, a model, and falls in love with her, introducing himself as Bholu.
Diya Abhyankar slowly falls in love with Radhe.
There are two gangs that operate under their jurisdiction, led by Dilawar and Dada Dagdu Dada respectively, who are at war with each other.
Radhe defeats all the men in Dagdu Dada's gang including Dada.
Radhe arrests one of Dada's men and questions him.
The arrested man tells Radhe that Mansoor deals with drugs.
Radhe goes to Dilawar's area and threatens his men to bring out Mansoor.
Dilawar agrees but Radhe arrests Dilawar.
Radhe makes Dada and Dilawar find peace with each other.
Diya is the sister of Radhe's senior officer Avinash Abhyankhar.
Avinash approves of their relationship.
Rana and his guards kill Dada's gang members.
Rana and his men brutally stab Dilawar to death.
Radhe gets information that Rana and his guards will be going to the Allied PD club.
Radhe goes to the pub and fights Rana in the restroom.
Radhe gets beaten up by Rana and his guards. They escape just as the police arrive.
Radhe, a police officer, is confessed his love by Diya.
Radhe convinces Mansoor to join his side while arresting him.
Radhe beats up Rana's guards with the help of Dagdu, but one of them escapes and informs Rana.
Rana kills Dagdu in revenge for Radhe's actions.
Radhe continues his job covertly with the help of Avinash when deemed incompetent.
One of Rana's guards, who was arrested, makes a deal with two police officers to let him escape in exchange for supplying them with drugs.
The two police officers, revealed to be hired by Radhe as a ruse, are captured by Radhe when they meet up with Rana's guard.
Rana finds out that Mansoor works with Radhe and kills him.
Radhe is a police officer who arrests Rana's gang and tries to capture Rana multiple times.
School students accept Radhe's offer to take photos of Rana's gang and the people they supply drugs to, which helps in their arrest.
Rana catches Nikisha but Radhe saves her from being killed by Rana.
Radhe tries to save Avinash from Rana's attack.
Some of Rana's guards escape after being arrested by the police officers, and Radhe kills most of them except for one who escapes in a helicopter with Rana.
Rana plans to move away from Mumbai and create a drug business elsewhere.
Salman Khan's next project after completing Dabangg 3 is Radhe, which was revealed through the motion poster of Dabangg 3; also confirmed to be a 2020 Eid release.
Radhe is scheduled for release on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr (22 May 2020).
According to an article from Deccan Chronicle, the project speculated for Salman Khan's next project after completing Dabangg 3 is a sequel to Wanted (2009) titled Wanted 2.
In October 2019, the film was rather confirmed to be an official remake of the 2017 South Korean film The Outlaws which is based on real-life gang wars between Chinese-Korean gangs in Seoul.
Salman Khan will be starring in the film Radhe.
Disha Patani has been cast in a pivotal role in the film Radhe.
Randeep Hooda has been cast in a pivotal role in the film Radhe.
Jackie Shroff will be seen in a pivotal role in the film Radhe.
According to reports, Bharath Srinivasan has been roped in for a role in the film Radhe.
Gautam Gulati has confirmed his presence in the film Radhe.
Radhe is the posthumous work of Wajid Khan (of the Sajid–Wajid duo) and the title track was his last composition before his death in June 2020.
Radhe is the first solo album of Sajid Khan.
Devi Sri Prasad recreated his song 'Seeti Maar' from the Telugu film DJ: Duvvada Jagannadham (2017) in Radhe.
Himesh Reshammiya has also composed one song in the film.

Radhe had a limited theatrical release on 13 May 2021, and Khan further announced that the film will be released in all operational theatres and on pay-per-view and digital streaming methods by Zee Plex and ZEE5 due to the closure of theatres in Mumbai and Delhi during the pandemic. The film became the first Indian film to have a hybrid release, and it was welcomed as a possible 'turning point' for Indian cinema's economy during the pandemic.
Salman Khan apologized to theatre owners for the poor collection of Radhe due to a limited theatrical release in a video-call interaction.
ZEE5 announced a Radhe Combo, a package priced at ₹499 allowing users to watch the film and access contents of the platform for one year.
Khan and Zee Studios announced that the revenues of Radhe will be donated to COVID-19 relief funds.
Khan and Zee Studios announced that the revenues of the film will be donated to COVID-19 relief funds.

The distribution rights of the film were sold to Yash Raj Films upon the initial release, but later in January 2021, it was reported that Khan had signed a new deal with Zee Studios, and sold the entire rights of the film (including theatrical, digital, satellite and music rights) to the company for ₹230 crore. The deal was later renegotiated citing the pandemic situation, with the revised bid being ₹190 crore in May 2021.

The film received highly negative reviews from critics and audience alike. On the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, the film holds a rating of 9% based on 11 reviews and an average rating of 1.6/10.
The film grossed over ₹18.33 crore (US$2.2 million). This was a limited second release post a successful reception as an OTT release at ZEE5 garnering over 14 million views.
This was a limited second release post a successful reception as an OTT release at ZEE5 garnering over 14 million views.
reiterates the fact that he is not looking at gaining any validation from the audiences taking them for granted
Trade analyst Taran Adarsh's review calling Radhe a 'disappointing' film.
Gave the film a rating of 2/5 and opined that 'The film dumps a whole lot of dross on us with a certain degree of surface stink.'
Saibal Chatterjee's opinion that 'Radhe has no inducements for diehard Salman Khan fans to keep them interested'
Namrata Joshi's criticism of the 'acutely conservative mindset of the makers and of the Salman Khan universe itself'
Sushri Sahu's criticism of Radhe for 'glorifying police brutality'
Sushri Sahu's criticism of Radhe for 'glorifying gun violence'
Sushri Sahu's criticism of Radhe for 'toxic masculinity'
The portrayal of police officers in the movie Radhe, as repetitively engaging in brutal actions, can be seen as a glorification of toxic masculinity.
The movie Radhe shows excessive use of guns by police officers, contributing to the glorification and repetition of police brutality and gun violence.
The movie Radhe seems like a promotional material for Khan's already well-known image, rather than an original work of art.
The movie Radhe doesn't even spare the minimum requirement of avoiding a single case of rape or assault, instead including it as a formulaic element.
